alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 04 at 6:57AM CDT until April 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected This Afternoon In Southern Portions of The Area... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS ALONG WITH FILLMORE, WEBSTER, NUCKOLLS AND THAYER COUNTIES IN NEBRASKA... * WINDS...For the majority of the area, winds will likely prevail from the north to northwest throughout the afternoon and evening, increasing to sustained 20 to 30 MPH and gusting to at least 40 MPH by late afternoon-early evening. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 to 25 percent for a few to several hours, with the overall-lowest values focused within Rooks, Osborne, Mitchell, Jewell and Thayer counties. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly. Use caution if engaging in activities that could result in fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
